thread.title: PRESS DIGEST- New York Times business news - March 20

title: PRESS DIGEST- New York Times business news - March 20
text: PRESS DIGEST- New York Times business news - March 20 Reuters Staff 2 Min Read   The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy. - Alex Stamos, Facebook's chief information security officer, plans to leave Facebook by August reflecting heightened leadership tension at the top of the social network. nyti.ms/2prEdnw - The Weinstein Company filed for bankruptcy protection late Monday in the United States Bankruptcy Court in Delaware. nyti.ms/2pp6gFc - On Monday, Claire's filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Delaware, hoping to shed $1.9 billion in debt and close some underperforming stores. nyti.ms/2HKMV8c - On Wednesday, the European Commission is expected to take aim at Silicon Valley's tech giants with a proposal to seriously revamp how technology companies are taxed in the 28-nation European Union. nyti.ms/2G7cEdD Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom
